content:
All that I'm really suggesting is that self-realization occurs when an individual understands what is *fundamentally* real in subjective experience. This allows the brain to stop operating on assumptions or models it is has accumulated or made up to try to make sense of its own insecurities, worries, speculations, and imagination. 

With regard to why it isn't another thing is it's just because that's what it is hahaha. "If my Grandmother had wheels, she'd be a bike!"

I am saying that the experience of human reality, what you call "Me" is sensory perception, and human perception only.

I am saying "buddy, you exist, the fuck is that?"

All you can be sure of is the perception your body processes and submits to your brain/consciousness. 

If it makes sense, what I am communicating to you *is that*

I am saying "you experience a human beings processing"

I experience that too

I am trying to say there are certain things that transform it's function that you can look into and incorporate.
